newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Repco CEO charged under Securities Act.
newsitem.headline: Repco CEO charged under Securities Act.

text.p: Repco Holdings Bhd's chief executive officer was charged with giving a misleading statement that could have affected trading in his company's stock, the national Bernama news agency reported.

Choo Chin Thye pleaded not guilty on Monday in the Sessions Court to the charge of giving a false or misleading statement on a material fact under the Securities Industry Act, Bernama reported late on Monday.
Shares of Repco, a timber and gaming concern, had risen sharply since last year on speculation about gaming licenses. Its shares jumped as much as 2,000 percent in one year.
Choo, who is also a company director, is accused of committing the securities offence on January 27, 1996.
His signature appears on a letter with that date sent from Repco to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange outlining a profit forecast for the years ending June 30, 1996 and June 30, 1997.

But a week after issuing that forecast, the company withdrew the letter and issued a lower profit projection, saying it had prematurely assumed approvals for a new gaming licence which were still pending.
Choo was charged under section 86 of the Securities Industry Act, which carries a maximum 10 years' jail or fine not exceeding 1 million ringgit on conviction, Bernama reported.
On Monday, Judge Zura Yahya allowed bail of 50,000 ringgit in two sureties pending trial on Feb 15 next year and impounded Choo's travel documents, Bernama said.
